entry.title: Aviva Health welcomes eight recently graduated doctors to family medicine residency program,
entry.summary: For Aviva Health, welcoming new practitioners into the Roseburg Family Medicine Residency program isn't just an expansion of their services. It's a chance to improve the well-being of their rural community as a whole.

entry.title: UACT goes Broadway with adaptation of "Anastasia"
entry.summary: Once a year, Umpqua Actors Community Theatre (UACT) puts on a production that goes all out, bringing big casts and big stories to the big stage. This time around, it'll be turning to post-imperial Russia for inspiration with "Anastasia."

entry.title: Umpqua Public Transport District swears in four board members amidst election challenge
entry.summary: The Umpqua Public Transportation District (UPTD) board swore in four new directors July 21 amid a controversial election challenge that has left one board seat vacant.

entry.title: Green Area Water & Sanitary Authority Reports Theft of Government Property
entry.summary: GAWSA is seeking help identifying individuals caught taking items from a government dumpster. While it may seem like simple dumpster diving, it’s illegal - trespassing and theft of government property. The act poses safety risks and violates public infrastructure protocols.

entry.title: Roseburg school district continues meal distribution
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Public Schools continues distributing free meals to children and youth throughout summer break via the LunchBox Express and at several school cafeteria sites.

entry.title: Spirit Halloween has location for 2025 Season
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — While Halloween is over three months away, Spirit Halloween has its Roseburg location set for its 2025 season. Spirit Halloween spokesperson Marisa Simonson said the seasonal pop-up will be in the Roseburg Marketplace, on Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard.…

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested for Stealing and Selling Items from Local Church
entry.summary: A Roseburg man was arrested after admitting to stealing and selling items from St. Joseph Catholic Church. Rad Cameron Osburn, 25, was already in custody for a separate case when police linked him to the burglary. He's charged with burglary, theft, and violating a restraining order.

entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Zumba in the Park continues Wednesday nights in Roseburg’s Stewart Park.

entry.title: Umpqua Community College Pool open afternoons
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — The Umpqua Community College pool is open to the community Monday-Saturday afternoons. Pool hours are weekdays from 1-4 p.m. and Saturdays from noon-5 p.m.

entry.title: Roseburg Fire Department Introduces Therapy Dog to Support First Responders
entry.summary: Roseburg Fire welcomed Lily, a certified therapy dog from CHI Mercy Health, to support first responders. Trained to ease stress and trauma, Lily provides comfort after difficult calls and was named Oregon’s 2024 Professional Animal of the Year by the state veterinary association.
